subject: AI & Agents
title: Emotions in AI: Simulation vs. Reality
description: A micro-lesson that makes Emotions in AI: Simulation vs. Reality usable.

hook.text: An AI therapist sounds warm, caring, and compassionate. But is there anyone home behind those words?

buildup.text: Affective computing aims to detect and respond to human emotions using voice, text, and facial cues.

discovery.text: These systems recognize emotional patterns. They don't experience emotions themselves.

twist.text: Simulated empathy can still help people. Therapy chatbots show measurable mental health improvements.

climax.text: The danger is when people form deep attachments to something that fundamentally cannot care back.

punchline.text: Helpful doesn't require feeling. But connection usually does.

quiz.question: What's the key difference between AI emotion simulation and real emotion?
options: AI recognizes emotional patterns but doesn't experience feelings
AI emotions are stronger than human ones
There is no difference at all
